intro: Gouania aphrodes, commonly known as the sacred plant of the Maya, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. It has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, particularly in treating skin conditions and as an antiseptic.
